DataElement.preferredName: Disease Response Spleen Ultrasound Assessment Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response regarding the state of clinical changes to spleen size assessed by ultrasound as a result of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach._High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: In medicine, an improvement related to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Property.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.:High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.
High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.
